p: We tested several candidate SARS-CoV vaccines in mice (representative reference, Yang et al., 2004), hamsters (representative reference, Roberts et al., 2010), and non-human primates (reviewed in Roberts et al., 2008). The vaccines included whole inactivated virus vaccines ( Roberts et al., 2010), purified expressed spike protein, DNA vaccine encoding the spike protein ( Yang et al., 2004), and several vectored vaccines (MVA, VSV, BHPIV3) expressing the spike protein ( Buchholz et al., 2004); all of the vaccines elicited neutralizing antibodies and protected the immunized hosts from infection on subsequent challenge with wild-type virus. We demonstrated that the antibody response and protective efficacy lasted 6 or more months with some vaccines ( Roberts et al., 2008, Roberts et al., 2010).
